question: In pediatric tonsillectomy patients, does intraoperative dexamethasone administration increase the risk of postoperative bleeding compared with placebo? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Dexamethasone, 0.5 mg/kg, was associated with the highest bleeding risk (adjusted relative risk, 6.80; 95% CI, 1.77-16.5).
content.source_2: Compared with dexamethasone at 0.05, 0.15, and 0.5 mg/kg, the placebo arm experienced a higher incidence of postoperative hemorrhage, and the between-group difference did not reach statistical significance (P = .31).
content.source_3: CONCLUSION In this study of children undergoing tonsillectomy, dexamethasone decreased the risk of PONV dose dependently but was associated with an increased risk of postoperative bleeding.
content.source_4: In a post-tonsillectomy cohort, 0.5 mg/kg dexamethasone was not linked to excess bleeding; only 2 of 53 children (4%; 95% CI, 0.5%â€“13%) experienced hemorrhage, comparable to placebo.
